Meditations on Flowers

I find great peace in looking at a wild flower the difference between us is minimal. The flower is, and grows and reproduces if possible. Perhaps it has no purpose. It doesn't seem to mind. There's nothing wrong with that, for the flower, or for me.

Author: Richard Packham

Sources: http://home.teleport.com/~PACKHAM/atheist2.htm
